alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western St. Lucie, southeastern Okeechobee and northwestern Martin Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Tradition, or 11 miles north of J And S Fish Camp, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western St. Lucie, southeastern Okeechobee and northwestern Martin Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
